input_text:
Job Title: Director of Preconstruction

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
General Overview:Woodstone, Inc. is a fast-growing progressive General Contractor, specializing in commercial construction including healthcare, hospitality, community, and residential.Woodstone believes in forming lasting partnerships with every client. We do this by building trust, being transparent, and always delivering a high-quality finished product. As a fast-growing company in the construction industry, we consistently work on new and unique projects – and we are always looking for talented individuals to join our team.We are currently seeking an experienced Preconstruction Director to join the team.Core Values:Our biggest differentiator is our people that embody Woodstone’s core values:IntegrityAdaptabilityCollaborationProblem SolvingFinisherWoodstone uses an Entrepreneur Operating System. This includes hiring, reviews, reward, and recognize people based on our Core Values.Essential Duties and Responsibilities of Preconstruction Director:High-level experience and understanding in:Leadership of the Preconstruction Team:Directing and coaching the Preconstruction Team with a focus on effective leadership to ensure cohesive collaboration and goal alignment.Management of the Preconstruction Team:Efficiently overseeing the day-to-day operations of the Preconstruction Team, ensuring tasks are executed promptly and in accordance with established core process.Accountability of the Preconstruction Team:Holding the Preconstruction Team responsible for their actions and ensuring collective accountability for project success.Key Steps in the Preconstruction Core Process:Improve the process that guides overall Preconstruction and all related activities.Ensuring completion of key steps in the Preconstruction Core Process, including internal kickoff meetings, cost estimation, invitation to bids, and participation in owner presentations.Cost Estimation:Collaborate with project stakeholders to establish and manage conceptual budgets.Align budgetary requirements with project goals in collaboration with design and engineering teams.Develop and oversee all cost estimates for projects.Identify opportunities for value engineering to optimize project costs without compromising quality.Explore alternate materials and construction methods for cost savings.Invitation to Bids:Oversee the bidding process, evaluating subcontractor and supplier proposals to facilitate an informed decision-making process.Work with team to develop clear concise scope and schedule and project requirementsParticipation in Owner Presentations:Actively participate in owner presentations, contributing to effective communication and understanding of project goals.Ownership of Consistent Development of the Company Estimating Database:Taking ownership of maintaining and enhancing the company's Estimating Database, ensuring its accuracy and relevance.Technology Utilization:Utilize construction management software and tools to streamline the Preconstruction Core Process.Stay informed about industry trends and advancements in construction technology, incorporating relevant tools for enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.This is just a partial list of what is expected to be a successful Preconstruction Director at Woodstone, Inc.Candidate ProfileStrong Leadership and Management skillsEmpathyWillingness to learnWillingness to mentor people and be mentoredGood teammateDetail orientedJob Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or related field with relevant experienceOr Associates Degree/Technical Certificate with relevant experienceProficient in Microsoft O365 softwareProcore experience is a plusViewpoint Spectrum experience is a plusOracle Primavera Cloud experience is a plusWhat We Offer:We offer competitive wages along with benefits which include:MedicalDentalEmployer paid life insuranceEmployer paid long-term disability401(k) with employer contribution matchPaid time off (PTO) and paid holidaysWoodstone, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.Job Type: Full-timePay: $120,000.00 - $180,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Construction: 1 year (Preferred)Procore: 1 year (Preferred)Oracle Primavera Cloud: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: In person

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Director of Preconstruction
output_json.summary: Woodstone, Inc. seeks an experienced Preconstruction Director to join their fast-growing team in the construction industry.
job_responsibilities: Improvement of the Preconstruction Core Process
Ownership of Consistent Development of the Company Estimating Database
output_json.company_information: Woodstone, Inc. is a fast-growing progressive General Contractor, specializing in commercial construction including healthcare, hospitality, community, and residential.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Woodstone, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

other.content:
Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or related field with relevant experience
Or Associates Degree/Technical Certificate with relevant experience
Proficient in Microsoft O365 software
Procore experience is a plus
Viewpoint Spectrum experience is a plus
Oracle Primavera Cloud experience is a plus
$120,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year
Benefits: 401(k), 401(k) matching, Dental insurance, Health insurance, Life insurance, Paid time off, Vision insurance
